post.body: and Dan was not on the show last time! Hopefully Mike will do it. He does an excellent job, just slowly. ;-)
don't worry about it, you'd do fine on a normal episode but this one's gonna be a bitch. Dan is the guy that gets us to shut up,
tell @pilotwill he's not allowed on any more podcasts 'til he edits the Pilotcast we recorded over a month ago now. >:-(
the "list" is @AeroTweets, follow them and you're on the list!
It's not much yet, but the unedited takeoff from Johnson Creek, ID 3U2 is here: http://tinyurl.com/mtntakeoff
yeah, and then I cried. ;-)
oh man, and here you got me all excited that there'd be a real solution to the pod-work. :-(
what does $250 at sporty's get you? A sectional and a kitchen timer? LOL
Zulu. I have one of their 3g's, they do customer service the right way and I love the headset. 8.8 hours in a day with it!
And of course, "Flight of Passage" by Rinker Buck, followed by listening to Pilotcasts 25 and 37A. :-)
For pilots, anyone who flies should have already read "Stick and Rudder" by Wolfgang Langewiesche. It's that good.
http://twitpic.com/uo91 - At TubaChristmas in the state capitol rotunda. What a neat sound!
http://twitpic.com/undr - Xmas tradition: going to cut the tree and play in the snow. :-)
Snow as of 12-20-08 already 29". Might be another doozy! Not sick of it yet at least.
Normal MSN seasonal snowfall 50". Previous record 76". 07-08 shattered record at over 100". Snow as of 12-20-07 25".
Getting ready to go get the Xmas tree, now that my sister is in town. We got her the white Christmas she asked for and then some!
One song, "Papa Whiskey November" about flying - Best lyric ever: "She's in love with a pilot, he's in love with the sky." :-D
Music recommendation: John Williamson, categorized as "country" in his native Australia, but nothing like our "country" music.
CFI Rick Durden's latest column is out, and very interesting as usual: http://tinyurl.com/436ovr
Blowing snow and listening to podcasts yet again.
